title: tour: Strange results with appending to slice...
body:
Context: https://tour.golang.org/moretypes/11

I typed the exact code in my editor and didn't get the result the go tour gives....
Here's the output on my install of Go :
```
a len=0 cap=0 []
a len=1 cap=1 [0]
a len=2 cap=2 [0 1]
a len=5 cap=6 [0 1 2 3 4]
```
Here's the go tour output with the same code :
```
a len=0 cap=0 []
a len=1 cap=2 [0]
a len=2 cap=2 [0 1]
a len=5 cap=8 [0 1 2 3 4]
```


Finally, here's the code:
```
package main

import "fmt"

func main() {
	var a []int
	printSlice("a", a)

	// append works on nil slices.
	a = append(a, 0)
	printSlice("a", a)

	// the slice grows as needed.
	a = append(a, 1)
	printSlice("a", a)

	// we can add more than one element at a time.
	a = append(a, 2, 3, 4)
	printSlice("a", a)
}

func printSlice(s string, x []int) {
	fmt.Printf("%s len=%d cap=%d %v\n",
		s, len(x), cap(x), x)
}
```
